p: ROS are a key determinant of cancer's metabolic phenotype [ 40]. Maintaining ROS within a narrow range allows malignant cancer cells to enhance their growth and invasion while limiting their apoptotic susceptibility [ 41]. Cancer cells actively modify their metabolism to optimize intracellular ROS levels and thereby improve survival [ 42]. Propolis treatment evidently increased the ROS level and decreased the mitochondrial membrane potential in MDA-MB-231 cells stimulated with LPS. The present results are consistent with our original findings, indicating that propolis increases the ROS level to promote cancer cells apoptosis.
